result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

from Jennifer Meetz

2:15 pm Defendant MATTHEW PAUL HUBBARD appeared by video, in custody in Winnebago County Jail.  Attorney John Miller Carroll appeared by video for MATTHEW PAUL HUBBARD.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Lynn Folger in court for the State of Wisconsin. State requests bond previously set to be reinstated as this was first offense. No objection from Atty Carroll.  Court reinstates signature that was previously ordered.

OWI-5TH OR 6TH
CONDITIONS:   Comply with the Alcohol 24/7 Program. Defendant shall contact (920)232-1919 IMMEDIATELY after their court hearing to schedule an appointment to be set up on the program.  If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  The defendant shall bring the Alcohol Monitoring Device to every hearing.  Absolute sobriety.  No alcohol consumption or possession.  Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
